intro: Ranunculus zhungdianensis, commonly known as the Zungdian buttercup, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from white to yellow. The plant has palmate leaves with deep lobes, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical specimen.
